website_summaries.verdict: Small, compact flash drive that works simultaneously between Mac and PC, so you never have to worry about reformatting the drive.
pros: We love that the DT50 can work simultaneously between Mac and PC
Small and compact with an eye-pleasing aluminum casing
With a few color options, this is a convenient way to organize multiple drives with different purposes, like red for homework, green for finances
cons: Drive gets hot after extended periods of usage

customer_reviews.title: Worked for 18 months
customer_reviews.text: I used this drive for almost a year and a half and it suddenly stopped working. My PC wouldn’t recognize the drive even though it would make the sound when you insert it I to the USB port. I tried 4 different computers and the 4th finally read the drive long enough to transfer the files I needed, then it stopped working again. I can’t rely on something that may or may not work when I need it.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Ok drive.  There are better choices.
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these to compare to the Samsung drives I have been very happy with. The Kingston has a 5 year warranty as does the Samsung - though it doesn't claim to be waterproof, shockproof, and dust proof. It does the the job. The Kingston drive has a key ring that is easier to attach to a key ring than the Samsung drive. However, the flat form factor makes it more difficult to insert and remove than the Samsung drive. As far as speed goes I copied a 3.4 gig file to each of the drives. It took less than half the time to wrtie the file to the Samsung drive as it did to the Kingston.
customer_reviews.author: JDB

customer_reviews.title: crashed 90 days after buying
customer_reviews.text: My original review was "tiny and awesome". However, it only took exactly 90 days for it to crash/fail. It's unusable. I called for replacement and Kingston gave me a phone number to a warranty/data recovery company who wanted to charge me for their services. They wanted me to mail them the drive, let them do whatever they do then mail it back. I wasn't happy and didn't end up sending it. I ordered another drive. SanDisk Ultra Flair USB 3.0 128GB Flash Drive High Performance up to 150MB/s (SDCZ73-128G-G46) to be specific. its been going strong 6 months now.
customer_reviews.author: Franco

customer_reviews.title: It's mostly made out of Metal, and not pastic
customer_reviews.text: As 83% expect, 115 GB to be exact, from an 128 GB USB, And this thing LABELed as 180 MB/s, but in reality its not. Also this Blue Flashing Light flashes, when its plugged in, and during Data Transfers. The computer with an external USB adapters (For example, my Corsair Keyboard external USB thingy built in my ) 128 GB USB > 3.0 adapter plug > 3.0 computer plug = About 37 MB/s 128 GB USB > 3.0 adapter plug > 2.0 computer plug = About 36 MB/s The computer: 128 GB USB > 3.0 computer plug = About 93 MB/s 128 GB USB > 2.0 computer plug = About 36 MB/s Bought this for $54.99 USD.
customer_reviews.author: dab*

customer_reviews.title: Compared to other 3.X USB drives
customer_reviews.text: Cons: Average transfer speed (75-100 MBps). Tested on a Dell Inspirion 8920 through the USB 3.1 port (on the back of the computer). Pros: This drive stayed relatively cool compared to the two San Disk drives, and was the coolest of the four I compared. This drive was 8 degrees F over ambient temperature (84F). The 128GB SD PRO was 17 degrees F over ambient temperature (84F). The metal shell appears to dissipate some heat over the plastic cased San Disk Extreme (non-Pro) 64GB version, which was 24F over ambient. The PNY Attache 64GB 3.0 (plastic case) was 12 degrees F over ambient. Temperature was measured with a IR thermometer (link below). Other USB flash drives compared to: Infrared Thermometer:
customer_reviews.author: aTypicalEngineer808

customer_reviews.title: Great keychain USB, but slow write speeds
customer_reviews.text: This flash drive has a really low Write Speed for a USB 3.0 device. Its read speeds are good. I was looking for a 128 GB USB that I could put on my keychain and not worry about it. At the time this review was written, this flash drive is the only full metal slim-sized 128 USB that fits on a keychain from a reputable brand. If you don't write large files onto the drive frequently, I would highly recommend this drive. If you need fast write speeds, this drive is not for you.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Oh

customer_reviews.title: Typical low-cost USB 3 flash drive
customer_reviews.text: As many other reviewers, I am using this for installers and disposable low-priority purposes. As far as drives of this type, it performs typically... it does better with large files, sequential transfers, and more poorly with writing files and smaller file sizes. I tested with the drive plugged directly into a USB 3.0 port. The drive maxed out around 120MB/s, which isn't bad for a drive of this type. It does reasonably well at read speed across the board, but crawls at writing with any file size. Based on the manufacturing, I expect that the drive would not last forever, and might fail easily, but I haven't tested or encountered this yet.
customer_reviews.author: W. Richards

customer_reviews.title: Solid small drive, but not very fast
customer_reviews.text: A serviceable, very compact & solid-constructed flash drive (64 gig), but in running several different speed tests (using Crystal Disk Mark 6.0.1), it fared poorly in file transfer speeds (incl deletion of a folder with several gigs in it) -- especially compared to a similar-priced & size Sandisk drive -- also USB 3.0. I ran a few manual file transfer tests as well (with a mix of small, medium & large files), and it okay, but not as fast as the Sandisk. I have had good luck with Kingston flash drives being reliable, and sometimes they are fast drives. This one also gets very hot..almost too hot to hold after a gig or so of file transfers.
customer_reviews.author: Devo

customer_reviews.title: Kingston finally listened to his buyers
customer_reviews.text: The DataTraveler Elite G2 is a pendrive that exceeded all my expectations: is made of metal, painted with a good coat of black paint that isn't slippery or scratched easily. Ah, and was made in Taiwan not in China! Its design is elegant and professional, allowing an anatomical grip. And possesses something that for me, never be missing in a pendrive: its led light, which indicates us safely if it is in use (theme that in Kingston have been ignoring many of its models and now fortunately is back). In short: by its weight, its anatomical style and design, its read and write speeds, I consider as the best Kingston's pendrive at this time.
customer_reviews.author: Rudy

customer_reviews.title: These things are defective.
customer_reviews.text: These USB keys are defective. I bought 3. All have the same problem. No matter what computer I use ( laptop, desktop server/Lenovo, Dell, HP, MSI) they all don't work as intended. I can get them to work by jiggling them around in the USB socket but that is a hit or miss. In my use case, it regularly sends Acronis boot CD (Linux) top a crash dump screen. In contrast, I have similarly shaped lower capacity Sandisk USB 3.0 keys that work without a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence S. Sinanan

customer_reviews.title: This USB Drive will not let me partition correctly.
customer_reviews.text: I am a company IT and bought this for the first time in addition to my Sandisk USB Drives. However, this product does not work as expected: I tried to partition it into 3 volumes, and it will get stuck or show error messages. I tried different formats: GUID, MBR, Ex-Fat, MacOS formats, but NON OF THEM WORKED. The USB drive will freeze and just can't correctly install an OS into it. I do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Tzu En Hu

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Thinking that it is a great usb driver for backup, I bought two. Well, unlucky. When I installed one, it got too hot and the computer detected the device as defective (windows 10). I tried to solve the problem following guide lines on the internet. Did not solve the problem. Then I installed the 2nd usb and it worked fine; the computer added to the working devices and it appears to be working. Some of the information I gather on the internet seem to imply that the usb not working is indeed defective and are made in China. So, I will never again buy from Kingston.
customer_reviews.author: Gonzalo

customer_reviews.title: Reliable as Usual
customer_reviews.text: I use portable drives a lot as part of my job (engineering), and I'm always paranoid about losing data. Been using Kingston USB drives almost exclusively for 20+ years and haven't had one fail yet. I generally have a primary and backup drive of different ages. This 64 GB one replaces a 32 GB version that's 3+ years old, about the longest I've ever had one without replacing it. My Kingston drives have always worked right out of the box; my old drives get wiped and used for personal stuff later. I like the small format of these drives, and I always put a lanyard on them to prevent loss. Overall, an excellent choice for any computer use.
customer_reviews.author: Spoon

customer_reviews.title: Died after light use.
customer_reviews.text: Like many others, I have had this flash drive stop working properly after relatively light use. Transfer speeds became erratic, and very very slow (<1KB/s!!). Chkdsk says the files are all okay. I decided to try a full format over an hour ago; it is only about 1/3 finished as I write. It's just the random defective unit, but from the reviews, I am far from alone. I won't be choosing this model for the replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: its a 115gb drive with 51.1MB write and 114MB read on FAT32 default
customer_reviews.text: i got this to replace my usb 2.0 drive i'v been using for years time for an upgrade i like the steel usb sticks i hope kensington will make a usb 3.1 in the future with similar design concept i like the capless all metal design. it's going to be my new EDC flash drive. honestly samsung should take note from the samsung bar series because i like how this fits on my keychain better than the samsung bar series.
customer_reviews.author: jean

customer_reviews.title: great little usb stick
customer_reviews.text: I love the Kingston usb sticks because I don't have to worry about the aluminum body breaking and falling off my key ring. They do get warm after extended use, these are for data carrying and transferring small files. Backup files before use as these do sometimes come DOA. For the price point and customer service I consider this a fair gamble, and I personally have 3 that have no issues after 6 months of use.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Great size!
customer_reviews.text: I had scanned all the old family slides, and was making binders with descriptions of all the slides. Originally I was going to put them all on disks, when I realized I would need like 3 disks per person. While I could have done that i thought of a different idea, and went with USB drives. I could put all the slides, scans of the descriptions. The drives still have plenty of space on them even with the 2000+ scans. I'm planning on adding more family pictures as I get them scanned in. Plus the size they fit nicely in the binders I made up with a printout of all the descriptions.
customer_reviews.author: Donna D.

customer_reviews.title: Reliable drive with indicator light
customer_reviews.text: I use this drive to transfer data from lab equipment that has been rather fickle with other brands of USB drives. I chose this drive because it has an activity indicator light. Some of our equipment offers no indication of when data transfer is in progress or complete. Therefore, I thought this activity indicator would be helpful. Unfortunately, the light is only visible from one side (would have been nice if the little light window were visible from both sides). Aside from that, it has basically worked very time. I also like that it seems solidly built from metal, and doesn't heat up nearly as much as the micro-size USB drives that I typically use for transferring files between computers.
customer_reviews.author: relativity17

customer_reviews.title: Nice little USB Flash Drive
customer_reviews.text: I picked this up to use on a key chain. The all metal makes it less likely to break and the key hole makes it perfect for the key chain. I loaded a Ubuntu Live to it as well as a host of other docs, app installers and the like as a 'rescue and recovery' solution and this fits the bill. I can boot almost any computer from it, do diagnostics, data recovery, etc. all from this key. I have had it on my chain and thus far the only sign of wear is the normal external scuffs and surface scratches from being on a key chain but the function has been flawless.
customer_reviews.author: My Side Of The Mountain

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: This is my second flash drive. Returned the first because it was defective. The second is no different. I'm in IT and a frequent user of flash drives. I plug and unplug on the average 12 times a day. There is certainly a design flaw with this drive. About 50% of the time the drive is not recognized. I finally discovered that if you wiggle the drive to the left, right, up or down you can find a position where it becomes active and windows will recognize it and then it can be used. It's a shame that a company as big as Kingston can't make a functional flash drive. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: TCG

customer_reviews.title: Design is the Key, get a thumb drive with the latch molded to the drive
customer_reviews.text: The best thing to know about these products is 1: buy American. Trying to shortcut with Chinese products will leave you very disappointed. 2: if you want a thumb drive with you all the time, get one that has the key ring attached to the actual thumb drive mold. I can't tell you how many thumb drives I lost by having a string break, or a malfunctioned latch, or a little chain break. You absolutely MUST get one with the mold loop attached into the drive. That being said, the only thumb drives I still have, such as this one, attach to my key chain without defect.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey N.

customer_reviews.title: works well so far
customer_reviews.text: I carry a thumb drive on my keychain for work (emergency boot device) and convenience (transporting documents and photos). I started with the earlier Kingston drive, with a metal body and a plastic loop. It came apart after some months in my pocket, and each time I fixed it, it broke in a different part. I finally discarded it and got two of these. They're much more robust, and the hole is large enough to put a carbiner through, so I don't have to use snap rings. It's not terribly fast, but I'm happy otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Christian

customer_reviews.title: These are all right
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 3 or 4 of these for different uses. They got here quickly and the flash drives by themselves and attractive and great for the price. I did research on the read and write speed and I should have paid more attention, I guess. It takes F O R E V E R to install portableapps on this flash drive because the write speed is so slow. I'm giving it 3 stars because these are great but the verdict is not completely out yet and I don't want to mar the ratings. Hence, right in the middle for now.
customer_reviews.author: Pai

customer_reviews.title: The small form factor is nice
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use as a Windows 10 install media, because the idiots at best buy degaussed the USB stick that came in the box I bought (they ran it over the magnet that deactivates security strips and it's a read-only drive). Anyway, the form factor of this is super slim and is a solid single piece of metal around the internal bits. It's well worth the buy. Additionally I like that it's labeling has the USB version as well as the storage amount on the stick. I own a few of these now in different sizes and the etched labeling makes my life pretty easy so I don't have to guess which is which.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel P.

customer_reviews.title: After a month of use it disconnects, reconnects repeatedly
customer_reviews.text: I only got less than a month of use out of this drive until it started to consistently disconnect and reconnect on it's own. I have switched the USB port to see if it's a faulty port and it still does it with the same frequency. I have just contacted Kingston tech support since it's outside of the 30-day return guarantee by Amazon. I didn't start using the drive until about a month ago, whereas I purchased it several months ago. I hope Kingston will honor their 5 year warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany D

customer_reviews.title: get a keychain or something to distinguish them
customer_reviews.text: I got a few to use one as a dedicated windows installer USB, a linux installer USB, and another to pass files between a Raspberry Pi and a laptop (the T400 in the picture), they are slim, they don't get in the way at all, but to distinguish them I had to put keychains on them, I would recommend these over thicker ones, because they don't get in the way of other USB connectors, even if the other connected devices have a thick cover over the USB
customer_reviews.author: El David Cordero.

customer_reviews.title: SLOOOOOWWWWW...
customer_reviews.text: 128GB Data Traveler SE9 G2 USB 3.0 (DTSE9G2/128GB) Windows 10 64-bit, running on a NUC NUC5i5RYK with USB 3.0 ports Also running MacOS Catalina on the 16" MacBook Pro 2019, Apple USB-C to USB-A adapter Performance is awful. I was trying to copy 30GB of file and it was crazy slow. I used Windows "winsat disk -drive d" command. Read and write performance looks OK at 40 and 25 MB/sec respectively, but the trouble is that the maximum latency is 4 to 5.5 SECONDS. There is something really, really wrong here. I returned the product.
customer_reviews.author: B. Hunsaker

customer_reviews.title: It works, the design is easy to find and use
customer_reviews.text: I mostly use this for remote installs and upgrades of 10, so it's only been written once, but it works. It's slightly more bulky than my other drives, which can be an advantage, as it is harder to lose and easier to unplug. The USB plug is sturdy enough it doesn't need a cover, and the design helps it stand out from the innumerable black slide drives in my bag. I don't know why anyone would rate the storage capacity they chose to buy as less then 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It is what it claims to be..... 128 GB of USB 3 storage in an aluminum shell.
customer_reviews.text: I liked this product line so much I bought several of each in different capacities. The lower capacities are great for making restore drives, while the higher are excellent for data such as music and photos. No complaints so far. (4x 16 GB, 1x32 GB, 5x64 GB, 2x 128 GB - only one of the 128 GB drives is waiting use, the rest are all serving their purpose very well while other USB drives from unknown makers have mysteriously "died" in less time with less use)
customer_reviews.author: Kirth

customer_reviews.title: Great for keeping your advance directive on! lol
customer_reviews.text: I keep my current documents on this, including last letters to my family, medical records from the hospital and doctors, an advance directive, and my voice memos. Goes with me on my key ring. We were rear-ended at full speed when we were stopped in traffic on the interstate. She was on her phone, and never braked. It's handy to have your information with you, not only in your wallet. A card in your wallet, pointing to this drive, might be handy, too. They look for medical cards when you're in the ambulance.
customer_reviews.author: Island Jane

customer_reviews.title: Issues with these
customer_reviews.text: One had a fatal error and kept acting like a disk drive that was empty (I sent it back for a refund). The other is very buggy and doesn't work on one of my computer's and the other one keeps giving errors even though it works on it (they are both Dell computers and I am not sure, but it seems like it could be driver issues). I have another drive brand that works great on everything I put it in so I give this 3 stars because I like the brand.
customer_reviews.author: Major Upset

customer_reviews.title: Five year warranty sold me...
customer_reviews.text: Thumb drives are not rated to last long compared to physical drives due to their internal charges eventually discharging. I chose the Kingston Digital 32 GB DataTraveler because of the long warranty, low price, and high reviews. I used the drive earlier today to make a recovery disk for my new laptop that does not have a recovery partition [what a nice surprise to find out a month after using the laptop]. Anyhow, here's hopefully I will never need the recovery disk. And if so, hopefully the disk reads and writes as accurately as hoped. Time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Biz Nerd53

customer_reviews.title: Slow by today's standards but it is cheap
customer_reviews.text: Excellent on a key chain. Slow by today's standards but it is cheap and the form factor is pretty good. I actually prefer the [ASIN:B00DYQYJ0E Kingston Digital DataTraveler SE9 32GB USB 2.0 Flash Drive ] because it is quite a bit shorter but this one has faster read speeds. These are great drives for basically giving to family and friends when you need to transfer files. These would be a poor choice for hosting a live OS, due to it's slow 4k performance. I've used the SE9 32GB for nearly a decade and they are still working great. Indestructible!
customer_reviews.author: anon

customer_reviews.title: Compact Flash Drive - Reads fast - Writes slow
customer_reviews.text: The Kingston all metal SE9 G2 drives are small and the compact metal case helps dissipate heat well. They come formatted as FAT 32. On a 4 GHz Core i7 fusion SSD machine I measured sustained read speeds of 125 Mb/s and write speeds around 12.5 Mb/s on a USB 3.0 port using the BlackMagic utility. This is decent, but not outstanding performance for a USB 3 drive, but is more than acceptable at this price point. They are supported by Kingston's 5-year guarantee. Formatted as supplied, the "16 Gb" drives I received had an available capacity of 15.49 Gb.
customer_reviews.author: Lotus-SevenTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Garbage, don't waste your money...
customer_reviews.text: I love the design and materials of this drive but the functionality has been dismal. I'm not sure if some of the problem stems from trying to use it between a PC and Mac system but the FAT file system is compatible with both OS's. It seems this drive randomly appears as read only and thus can't have files transferred to it. Sometimes running disk check software and ejecting and re-inserting will cause it to switch back to read and write capable but it's not reliable which is a necessity for me. I tried formatting it with Mac FS to see it it would work with the Mac only but it just doesn't work...
customer_reviews.author: Goodneighbor

customer_reviews.title: Super super super... did I mention super slow...
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't even perform up to USB 2.0 standards let alone 3.0. It is by far the worst USB drive I have had in years. I use a lot of drives across both Windows and Linux. It performs poorly on all systems. It's terrible at all file systems, I've tried exFat, NTFS, FAT, FAT32...doesn't matter. It starts out quick, but then quickly degrades down to near 0 bytes/s. The best sustained rates I've seen with two of these drives is 128kb/s. That's simply not acceptable for a drive labeled as 3.0. Want my money and more importantly, my time, back.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Electronics

customer_reviews.title: Large USB flash drive, but runs VERY hot in my Tesla
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this since it would draw very little power in my Model 3, but it runs so hot, that it stops working often. I have gone back to my older USB 3 reader with a 64GB SD card installed. It NEVER gets hot. I will likely use this as a backup only, but still search for a better, cooler, flash drive.
customer_reviews.author: DLn

customer_reviews.title: best keychain flash drive ever
customer_reviews.text: these Kingston flash drives are fantastic. I bought a 15 GB version of this years ago. probably about 7 years ago I thought that. and it is still working today and I carried it on my keychain all those years. they have never broken off. they're only caught on that I would have for this is that I wish that it had a cover for the flash drive. but it has never been an issue so it doesn't really matter. I highly highly highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Eye Lens Visuals

customer_reviews.title: Portable, Reliable way to keep your imporant files on you at all times
customer_reviews.text: I love that this device doesn't have a usb port that slides out- as I've noticed these types of USB's starting falling off/breaking over time. I use this little piece for DJing as it's a great way to always have my music on me. Add it to your keychain or necklace for a ready-to-go playlist! You can also keep your resume in here Other great features: -Small/Compact -Sleek design -Quick loading files. 10/10!
customer_reviews.author: nichol

customer_reviews.title: This thing is a TANK!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this thing to be a more durable 3.0 option to leave on my key ring for everyday use. I keep about 50 gb of misc. files for work and hobbies ect. on there and it hasn't let me down yet. It is extremely rugged. I beat my keys around a lot, throw them, wash them, drop them and this flash drive has taken it like a champ. I don't know exactly how it is rated but it has been dunked in water for significant amounts of time and after it dries out over a couple days works just fine!
customer_reviews.author: Will S.

customer_reviews.title: This thing BARELY fits in a slot.  Be careful
customer_reviews.text: This is sleek and cool and very durable BUT, you have to seriously jam this thing into a usb slot. I tried it on 3 different computers (ASUS, HP Chromebook, Apple Type-A dongle) and it is hard to get in and very hard to pull out. Its nice but not sure its worth possibly breaking a port on your computer for.
customer_reviews.author: simple SW man.Top Contributor: Raspberry Pi

customer_reviews.title: 4.5 years later, still going strong
customer_reviews.text: I have carried this guy on my keychain every day for the last 4.5 years and it is till working great. It has taken a beating, gotten banged around, gotten wet, and through 4.5 years of daily carrying it still works! Durable is an understatement with this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Overstreet

customer_reviews.title: Bad Manufacturing do not buy this drive
customer_reviews.text: This product failed after just a few months and I lost all the data on the drive. There was no way to save or repair on windows it just would no longer read on either my android phone or my windows 10 computer, what a pain! I have never ever had a zip drive fail. I did on online search and found another happy user who bought 10 of these units and they all failed within a few months. Stay far way from kingston products
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Transfer Rates Are A Joke.
customer_reviews.text: I have used many Kingston products. On the whole, they are reliable and well made. I guess with this USB drive, you get what you pay for. The build quality is great, the drive is sturdy even the design is pleasing to look at, but transfer rates are a JOKE. I have used it on several PC's with USB 3.0 connections, and this drive transfers at USB 2.0 speeds at best.
customer_reviews.author: L. Darthard

customer_reviews.title: Horrendously slow
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for some durable drives to throw on my keyring and keep handy, for things such as Windows 10 Recovery Drives, file storage, games, etc. As an IT tech, keeping things like this on hand is essential. So, what better drive to go for then this drive? They work great for keeping on my keyring, which is not my issue. My issue is that my 64gb Usb 3.0 drive writes file so slow. Reaching 8mb/ps is difficult, and is just abysmally slow for a 3.0 drive plugged into a 3.0 port. TL;DR good durability and portability, terribly slow speed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: really wide so you cannot insert this next to any other USB drive
customer_reviews.text: Really wide so you cannot insert this next to any other USB drive in a hub or laptop. Works OK; a little slow, more like 2.0 rather than 3.0. Would not buy again, but it was cheap at $6.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Seda

customer_reviews.title: Works, very sturdy and I have faith that it will last a few years on my key chain
customer_reviews.text: Works, very sturdy and I have faith that it will last a few years on my key chain like the unit it replaced (another Kingston, still works. but now too small). Does not get as hot as some other USB3 ones I have used.
customer_reviews.author: RomanS

customer_reviews.title: 2 of 3 sticks were malfunctioned from the get go. Kingston, I used to trust you peeps.
customer_reviews.text: Bought 5 sticks. 1 will not even format. Another I formatted fine, wrote data to it, then when I tried transferring the data over I kept getting read errors, basically lost data!! Basically, 2 of 3 sticks were malfunctioned from the get go. Kingston, I used to trust you peeps. Sucks because I am now loving in Chile and had my stuff shipped here. Will stick with Patriot and other brands in the future!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Guzman-Escobar

customer_reviews.text: I LOVE these things. I had 2 of the older G1 design on my keychain before. They were extremely durable and well-built. This one doesn't make quite as satisfying a sound as the old ones to me, but that's hardly what I look for in a flash drive. I was able to transfer 12 gigs of video to and from this thing in about 10 minutes, so I'm very happy with the speed as well and will be dedicated to these DTSE9s for all my flash drive needs for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: hydraulix

customer_reviews.title: Compact, economical, super for spares, throwaways, or lending
customer_reviews.text: These work great, and they're inexpensive enough that I don't mind buying several and handing them out with no expectation of having them returned. They're also great for storing stuff and carrying back and forth to work. They're also compact. I try to keep a selection of decently sized inexpensive flash drives tucked around for such purposes, and these are great. They're fast, economical, and just plain handy to have around. Very happy with the quality of these flash drives. Very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: 📚 Bookwyrm 📚Top Contributor: Brewing

customer_reviews.title: CONTENT CREATORS BEWARE!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this USB stick because I am a content creator that works for a large church. I needed a way to transfer files from computer to computer Easily and reliably. The problem is that a lot of times I’m transferring anywhere from 500MB to 7GB at a time, it takes soo long to transfer and most of the time large transfers fail because the drive overheats and shuts off before it can finish. I love the form factor and the fact that it fits well on my key chain but it is unusable for the use case I expected it to be able to handle
customer_reviews.author: Robert S.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't seat well in any USB port I own
customer_reviews.text: I've had to purchase 6" USB extension cables for everywhere I plug this device in...which kind of defeats the purpose of it's portability. I carry it on my key ring...plus I need the cable...where do I keep that? It is a very substantial device that easily fits on the ring and isn't obtrusive in the least. All of that is negated by the fact it can't be read in a port without me keeping pressure on it with my hand.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Carr

customer_reviews.title: Mobile
customer_reviews.text: You would be surprised how hard it is to find a thumb drive with a lanyard hole that facilitates removing and putting it back on a split ring. I needed a sizable drive, with a very sturdy housing, and a ring hole that makes it easy remove it from your key ring, copy files, then put it back on the key ring fast and easy. Makes it impossible to loose it by forgetting you put it in your pocket. Keeping it on your key ring, you never forget it. Amazon also sells a small, stainless spring loaded split ring that works perfectly with it.
customer_reviews.author: Brac

customer_reviews.title: Within 2 weeks of usage, I now get a ...
customer_reviews.text: Within 2 weeks of usage, I now get a message that the disk is write-protected. I have tried to format the drive with at least 10 different software with no success. Upon further research I've found out that it may be the firmware that may be corrupt and would need re-flashing. Update 11/20/2016: My first drive was replaced by seller... Worked good for two months then same error happens to the second one!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 15 mps  YES  15 m per second write speeds
customer_reviews.text: Works good once you fill it up , I only wanted it for a portability use so it works good as a read from source. I would not buy this one if you wanted a fast USB or you plan on using this one daily as others are better for that purpose. If speed is of no concern, which it wasn't for me, It's Good ! it'll hold 128 G, and works from USB 2.0 & 3.0. But to call it a 3.0 USB drive. well it transfers at 15 milliseconds a second , so idk
customer_reviews.author: Dv

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected but not the fastest and no light indication.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I needed a USB3 USB drive for general use. It's decently fast, but got blown out of the water in speed tests when compared to the much cheaper "Micro Center" branded ones. Another annoyance is the complete lack of an LED to indicate operation. On the plus side, they're nicely built (although a bit too small and I find them hard to remove).
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Man

customer_reviews.title: Best design
customer_reviews.text: I have used flash drives, carried on my key ring for an extra layer of backup for many, many years. Different manufacturers, different write speeds and they all have had problems after time. This unit is best designed one I have had. While the write speed is not the fastest, it is fast enough. Hence the 4 star rating. At this price, I am going to buy another to have when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Knapp

customer_reviews.title: Kingston - Reliable, Durable, Kinda fast
customer_reviews.text: Works well for my everyday storage needs. Beacuse it's a Kingston device, I know I can depend on its reliability. Fromated my 64 GB stick to exFAT however the write speeds (~10-15 MBps on average) leaves much to be desired. Had a PNY TURBO USB 3.0 for 5 yrs and was spoilt by its then impressive write speeds (~25-50 MBps on average). Update: 3/8/2019 Change my ratings from 4 stars to 3. I thought I could live with the dismal write speeds but I was DEAD wrong. The aforesaid PNY drive really spoilt me. I've ordered a Samsung USB 3.1 flash drive with write speeds up to 200 MB/s. Hopefully this will satisfy my speed addiction.
customer_reviews.author: Simpson Powers Jonez

customer_reviews.title: Slooooow
customer_reviews.text: I bought two 128GB drives at the same time--this one and a Samsung BAR Plus. Copied an identical set of 75GB of files to each. The Samsung took about 35 minutes. This Kingston took over FOUR HOURS. Don't waste your money, buy the Samsung. Same price. Much better performance.
customer_reviews.author: stuart feldman

customer_reviews.title: SPEED is a bizarrely slow
customer_reviews.text: I see many reviewers rate this highly. I have trusted Kingston in the past. This time the product is defective on my system - crazy slow - takes hours to do a back-up job which is fast on other - smaller and larger flashdrives. Using a USB 3.0 port which is faster with other drives; this drive has lots of spare memory space; thus, no explanation for slowness. Maybe a quirk in my own computer, but as far as I know it is indeed this flashdrive.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer X, LA

customer_reviews.title: Won't work on front-panel USB 3.0 ports (desktop PCs)
customer_reviews.text: Does not work at all in desktop PC front-panel USB 3.0 port. Similarly doesn't work in powered (with separate power supply) USB 3.0 hub. Works in front-panel USB 2.0 port and also USB 3.0 ports on the back of the PC (those that are on the motherboard. Kingston's support information confirms that it may not work anywhere but in the backside/motherboard USB 3.x port. Ridiculous! I imagine it probably works OK in a laptop USB 3.0 port but have none available at the moment to test. Same situation with another higher-capacity Kingston Data Traveler 106 drive.
customer_reviews.author: LRC

customer_reviews.title: Not recognized on most computers
customer_reviews.text: This is the worse USB drive I have used . It's mostly not recognized on most computers I put it in. I maintain a 200 computer network so I put it in a decent amount of computer. Sometimes you can plug it in and out a few times and it will pick it up. When it does work the write speed appears slower than advertised although I have not officially tested. Pick another drive and pass on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn S.

customer_reviews.title: Bad experience
customer_reviews.text: I threw it away after owning it less than two weeks. I just ordered a replacement, not Kingston! Trouble started right out of the box. Finicky about writing and didn’t want to eject. I reformatted it. Temporarily better then again didn’t want to eject or even erase files. I reformatted yet again. Same issues and then finally it refused to unmount. Buh-bye!
customer_reviews.author: a work in progress

customer_reviews.title: Did not work
customer_reviews.text: Purchased two of these for my job (teacher) so that I could save and upload information for students. I work on two campuses, so I purchased one for each campus. One worked right out of the package and I did not have a need to try the 2nd one until today. Nothing. Will not be recognized, will not save data. So I guess you could say it half worked.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Great little usb keychain drive
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these on my keychain (smaller capacity) and then "upgraded to a usb3" device with another brand. That other brand USB 3 device got so hot and was designed very oddly where it awkwardly stuck out on my keychain. So after much frustration I went back to the Kingstons that I loved in the past and I'm content again. I love the simple/straight design, and the tough outer shell on these things. I have one on my home keychain and my work keychain and they both work like champs. This is my personal favorite design due to durability, simplicity, fit on the keychain, and size.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Kingston USB drive 64GB great for price
customer_reviews.text: Kingston 64gb. I carried a mini drive for years and finally went with one that's deemed to be waterproof. I prefer one that retracts because I don't want to have an issue with the End Breaking but I also have to go with the theory that the manufacturer took this into account. I've only owned this for a few months and I'm not a daily user. Definitely small and convenient to hide pictures of your ex-girlfriends from your current.
customer_reviews.author: Lee K. Sachs

customer_reviews.title: DT60 16GB suddenly became 3.4GB (to fdisk but not to gnome-disks), refused to take writes
customer_reviews.text: *** This review is for "Kingston 16GB USB 3.0 Data Traveler 50, 30MB/s Read, 5MB/s Write (DT50/16GB" ASIN:B01JHE50KY *** When used as a DVD substitute, it took literally all night to write a DVD image, and then didn't finish. That's when I discovered various failures. At $3.99 it's not even worth further testing, but be warned....
customer_reviews.author: True Builder

customer_reviews.title: DT106 - Slow for a Kingston USB 3 flash drive.
customer_reviews.text: Slow. Why make these drives so wide? Hard or impossible to fit two side by side on most laptops or hubs. For the same price buy the Over 50% faster write than these Kingston Digital DT106/16GB USB 3.0 DataTraveler version. DT100G3 averaged 18.6+ MB/s vs DT106 averaged <11.4 MB/s write.
customer_reviews.author: Marlin

customer_reviews.title: For the Money... 5 Star... I mean $4 shipped free?!! No Brainer
customer_reviews.text: I use this type of memory as a giveaway to friends. Hey, a 16GB 3.0 under $4.00! Religiously, for years, every USB Flash I get I check the read/write speeds using the free cklflsh ... Measurements: this one came in at write 10.88 / Read 115.68. Which is an adequate write speed for a cheap gift USB flash and great read speed for photos or for a video. Think... BrandName Kingston @ $4 +free shipping. Again, No brainer
customer_reviews.author: fdoamerica

customer_reviews.title: The perfect little memory stick
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure this is the fastest memory stick in my collection, but I TRUST Kingston. I have a 32GB Kingston that's at least five years old, and it still works well. Kingston costs a bit more but if you want a memory stick that will be functional years from now, then I suggest you pay a little extra. (I think I had to reformat this from FAT32 to NTFS, but it was easy and there are no problems as of now.)
customer_reviews.author: R.S.

customer_reviews.title: top is not attached
customer_reviews.text: Good size, good shape, narrow so doesn't pose problem for inserting other plugs alongside. Seems reasonably fast transference of docs. Probably good enough for five stars, but lost one for what I now see as a design fault, namely the drive has a cover over its interface which detaches from the stick when you need to use the drive. Perfectly fine if you don't lose the cover. I have never lost a cover until this one, and now I realize why covers should be attached to jump drives.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela L. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great giveaway drive
customer_reviews.text: This was the cheapest name brand usb 3.0 drive I could find. It’s great as a giveaway drive. I paid $6 for a 16gb drive. Very good deal. I wouldn’t recommend this as a primary use drive because it is not very fast. Pros: Low cost Decent speed No cap to loose Cons Not very fast
customer_reviews.author: E. N. M.

customer_reviews.title: Not great, but very good.
customer_reviews.text: With a one-piece metal body it's super-compact, durable, and easy to use--though I'm not seeing a huge difference in its 3.0 speed as opposed to the speeds for my 2.0 USB drives. I'm also not thrilled with the usable capacity, which is 11GB less than the advertised 128. Still, the sturdiness and small size are very good for the price, and the unit features a built-in keychain loop that would make losing it pretty tough. So not the blazing speeds and modest capacity-gap I'd hoped for, but still a nice, reliable drive for $50.
customer_reviews.author: C. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Nice form factor for keychain usage, feels sturdy enough, capacity as advertised
customer_reviews.text: The form factor of this flash drive makes it perfect to carry around on a keychain. Although the thickness of the metal around the hole looks a bit thin, I haven't had any issues with the durability or build quality. I also haven't really noticed transfer/write speeds being really slow as many people have stated - though I certainly don't think it's as fast as advertised. Capacity was as listed - all drives are just a smidge less than they are labeled, that's not unique to this drive or Kingston what-so-ever. Time will tell how this holds up, but for now, I'm satisfied with the capacity and form factor for the price point.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Very handy.
customer_reviews.text: Nothing special about this other than it's very sturdy (metal) and it fits on my key chain. This means it's always on hand when I need it. My previous one lasted many years, even though it suffered a lot of abuse. The only reason I had to buy another one is the previous one was loaned to someone who apparently liked it too much to give back.
customer_reviews.author: Deo Vindice

customer_reviews.title: Decent, but slow
customer_reviews.text: The Kingston 64G Traveler SE9 drive has disappointed me mainly due to the transfer speed. I tested in both Windows 7/10, exFat/NTFS, with large A/V files as well as smaller office files. It normally starts strong but the transfer speed quickly drops off to below 10 MB/S. By comparison, my PNY 128GB flash drive almost double or triple the speed in the same environment. I am revising my review to 4 stars after testing a similar drive (Samsung 64GB Bar) which has slightly better transfer speed. So I guess it is not entirely fair to compare this compact drive to PNG 128GB. In addition, I grew to like the sleek design, it is the main reason gave it 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: copperzammer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Key Ring Flash Drive
customer_reviews.text: This is my second DataTraveler (upgraded from the old 16gb version) and I love it. It is incredibly compact, sleek, and fits on your keys great. My other one is several years old and has held up well. It has some scratches from years of being on the keychain, but it works great and looks just fine. Strongly recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: Xander Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Flawless Flash Drive!
customer_reviews.text: I love this! Will never part with it, and it's on my keychain. It has all of my music, favorites movies/tv, AND my school/work documents. 128Gb Flash drive? It's perfect, and very fast! Going to buy another one to install a bootable Linux (likely Mint) for file recovery and other IT purposes. Would be awesome if Kingston came in different colors, and still be made of metal! I'd give a 6/5, but I can't. Great item, great price, and a great sell means great buy. FLAWLESS EXPERIENCE! 5/5 JBM
customer_reviews.author: Seriusdude

customer_reviews.title: Really bad performance for the class of Flash Drives
customer_reviews.text: A have been an avid purchaser of Kingston products over the years and have found most the DataTraveler series reliable, dependable and have good performance. Unfortunately these 50 series do not live up to the standards of the DataTraveler type. I use these drives primary for encrypted storage and they perform very slowly when mounting my encrypted volumes and they overheat when transferring many files to and from. I was looking for something more portable then the DT 100 series but these do not fit the bill. Ill have to try another brand or series to see if I can find ones that are not to bulky but perform better.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Larson

customer_reviews.title: sleek and fast flash drive, a steal for 7$
customer_reviews.text: It has wonderful performance compared to most flash drives, and the cheapness of the gigs is also nice. I use this usb drive for school and it's tiny size meant I had to attach it to a lanyard (smaller than the top half of your pinky). It's very sleek and durable, made of all metal. I think it should last a long time, and for seven bucks it's a steal
customer_reviews.author: MR28

customer_reviews.title: Works Well And Fast.
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. Works reliably and as fast as advertised here, which is even faster than listed on package. Not quite as fast as Samsung higher capacity units, but for a 32 GB stick available now, it was the fastest I could find that did not have many complaints. See graph for read / write. If you need a 32 GB stick, this is a great choice.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality!
customer_reviews.text: I love how small, light and slim this is, plus it fits on my keyring. Can't beat the price - 32GB for $7! I put a TON of music on it and it's still got a lot of room. I don't know what other reviewers were referring to as 'slow' - I play music from it in my car and it performs great. I've bought 2 of these.
customer_reviews.author: Dragoness

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love
customer_reviews.text: I also had the previous, smaller version of this drive. Perfect for a keychain to take with you on the go, wherever you go. Store your pictures or documents, encrypt it in case someone else gets a hold of it. Love that it can be put on a keychain, one of the reasons I love this one so much. I've had no issues with it.
customer_reviews.author: moshinoto

customer_reviews.title: Super fan alert.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specifically to download ALL of the seasons, deleted scenes, and bonus footage of Scrubs so I can take it WHEREVER I go. It's got great storage capacity and stays on my key chain. So far I have had no issues with it breaking or not working. It is very sturdy, if that's the correct word. haha
customer_reviews.author: Charlene P.

customer_reviews.title: What a piece of crap!
customer_reviews.text: What a piece of crap! This USB drive broke immediately. Well, not immediately, but it only lasted a few months. Enough said. In the future I will be buying boring sandisk cruzer usb drives. The premium look and feel of this item was all "look" and no function. Buyer beware! A buddy of mine bought one at the same time, and it quit being recognized recently as well. Not cool.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: G A R B A G E  - 6mt life and that was it
customer_reviews.text: got this thing in march '17 , started to go stupid in august and its dead beginning of September. maybe you get a good one (wish you luck) this one is heading straight for the garbage- wasted 30buck .
customer_reviews.author: HCSN

customer_reviews.title: Mostly good
customer_reviews.text: Looks good, great portability and plenty of space. Unfortunately the stick started to become unreadable by usb ports after a few months. Fun fact, these things have a 5 year warranty so I'm attempting an RMA via warranty coverage. We'll see how it goes. Edit: I did receive a brand new replacement through warranty so I'm adding another star back.
customer_reviews.author: Zach g

customer_reviews.title: Gets very hot.
customer_reviews.text: This product serves me very well and is very fast for transferring files between devices. But for the way I use it, I have found it almost unusable. I use it to store Lightroom Catalogs to edit my pictures on my laptop when traveling. When using it for this purpose, especially with larger catalogs (for me over 6000 images), this drive gets very hot and very slow to the point where I cannot use it (the slowness, not the heat). So, since I cannot use the catalog directly from this drive, I always copy it to my local drive, and copy it back once done (adds more risk). Also, (trivial) I already lost the cap :(
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Easily gets "loose" and does not reliably connect in the USB port
customer_reviews.text: The casing or circuit board inside this is somehow not quite the right size. On multiple machines I find the drive needs to be held "up" in order for the USB contacts to make a connection. This is most annoying as whenever you let go the drive "disconnects". Otherwise, the drive is fast and good. Love the form factor. Just wish it mechanically worked better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fat and hot, but is working
customer_reviews.text: The usb drive works but is fat, so it interferes with other USB connections. It also gets hot to the touch. Not so hot that I cannot hold it, but much hotter than my other thumb drives. I worry that the heat may get worse with time. It is a distinctive shape and color, which helps identify it.
customer_reviews.author: The Careful Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Must have gotten a bad batch...
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these model USBs for years with no issues, wanted a new 3.0 128GB for my keys and the one I got is almost unusable, extremely slow, and drops off the USB port while uploading to it all the time. I ordered a replacement from amazon that functions exactly the same. It's too bad because the two older drives I have of this model in 3.0 both work great and have for a few years now. I use them for DJing and the new one would not read or drop out on most CDJs, and be incredibly slow to access. I've never seen a CDJ say "please wait" while loading a 5 minute song in mp3.
customer_reviews.author: Winslow B.

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and durable USB flash drives
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying the metal Kingston USB drives for years. I've given them my kids that have used them though high school and now college. It's the only brand I'll buy.
customer_reviews.author: psk op

customer_reviews.title: Fast, but didn't last too long.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this on Feb 24, 2018 and got it the first week of March. Was working fine till a couple of weeks ago, around the fifth of September when it suddenly would not show up when plugged into any computer (usb 2 or usb 3 ports). Could not even format it. Seems funny it only lasted 6 or 7 months before dying. Guess I didn't win the silicon lottery on this one. I guess I could have contacted the company I bought it from, but I figured it wasn't that big of a deal, but it would have been nice if it lasted a little bit longer. ;)
customer_reviews.author: SantaFe

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Key Ring
customer_reviews.text: I keep a thumb drive on my car-key ring at all times. It's a convenient way to have storage with me at all times. These have a particularly small profile. Better still, they work well. I've used other, cheaper brands; They're usually full of "crap ware" that requires reformatting to remove. I like that Kingston doesn't load their thumb drives with software I don't want or need. (Tech Support was not rated because they haven't been required.)
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Great drive...until it fails.
customer_reviews.text: Had this drive for less than 6 months and it has failed. Can't wipe the drive or reformat it, as it says the drive is read-only. Tried partition tools, registry settings an using multiple computers to repair with no success. Second Kingston thumb drive to die on me. Switching back to SanDisk from now on.
customer_reviews.author: dean ansley

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 2 years of VERY light use
customer_reviews.text: I maybe used this once a month or so over 2 years to redundantly back up some personal files and at most used 30-40% of the drives capacity. It fortunately didn't completely fail at first and I was able to piece by piece cherry pick my data off, but now it sits as a paper weight on my desk.
customer_reviews.author: Review_Ninja

customer_reviews.title: Great USB Drive
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent USB drive for the cost. I have used these for multiple purposes, from storing files to running various Linux distros. You would be hard-pressed to find another 64 GB USB drive this sturdy and reliable for a similar price. It also fits nicely on a keychain and does not add any bulk. I usually keep at least one of these on my key ring. I have had no issues with the write speeds using a USB 3.0 port.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty (literally) and nice USB memory!
customer_reviews.text: I got 5 of these for my Tesla Model S dash cam storage because bigger USB's are keep on failing. I have these marked with numbers, and I am rotating them around. Tesla recommended 32GB storages. That's why I purchased these since I wanted reasonably priced real USB 3.0 drives. Be careful there are tons of fake USB 3.0 drives.
customer_reviews.author: eTom K.

customer_reviews.title: Much faster read than write speed
customer_reviews.text: On a Late 2013 Retina MacBook Pro 13-inch, using AJA System Test Lite at default settings on High Sierra 10.13.6, reformatted as GUID format, HFS+: Read speed: 226-228 MB/sec Write speed: 86 MB/sec Good as a system install drive or bootable recovery, surprisingly small, does get a little warm if used as a startup drive. My SanDisk Extreme USB 3.1 128 GB does Read: 326 MB/sec Write: 56 MB/sec so It's a push I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Rocky Clark

customer_reviews.title: SLOW!  Slower than 2.0 version in randow write
customer_reviews.text: I like the shape and external build of these drives. But the speed is abysmal. The read speeds are okay, but the write speeds are garbage, especially the random write. My Samsung Bar is 3 times faster at sequential write and ONE THOUSAND times faster random write. I am very disappointed. I thought that Kingston would make a drive internals as nice as the outside. I really wish they did. :(
customer_reviews.author: Keenan

product_meta.title: Kingston 32GB USB 3.0 Data Traveler 50, 110MB/s Read, 15MB/s Write (DT50/32GB)
product_meta.description: Size:32GB| Style:DT50| Product Packaging:Standard PackagingData traveler 50 is a lightweight USB Flash drive. The drive’s compact, cap less design features a metal casing that complements any compatible device and colorful accents that range by drive capacity. Fast USB 3.1 Gen 1 (USB 3.0) performance ensures data transfer of music, video and more is quick and easy. Backward compatible with existing USB 2.0 ports for convenience. Dt 50 is backed by a five-year warranty, free technical support and legendary Kingston reliability.
feature_bullets: Small and compact - the lightweight storage solution that’s easy to take with you
Metal casing - complements any compatible device; no cap to lose or break
USB 3.1 Gen 1 (USB 3.0) speeds: 110MB/s Read, 15MB/s Write - faster than USB 2.0 Flash drives
Large capacities - to take all your files with you

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars22,329 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
